intro: Dicoma cana, commonly known as the white-headed daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its white to pale yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of yellow tubular flowers. Its leaves are typically hairy and arranged in a basal rosette, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Dicoma cana is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
